meanings.definition: The state or quality of being inapplicable.
meanings.sent1: The inapplicabilities of the old rules confused the students.
meanings.sent2: The teacher explained the inapplicabilities of using outdated technology.
meanings.sent3: The inapplicabilities of wearing a swimsuit in winter would be quite chilly.
meanings.sent4: Her stubbornness was like the inapplicabilities of trying to fit a square peg into a round hole.
meanings.sent5: The inapplicabilities of using a hammer to write an essay were quite evident.

meanings.definition: The lack of relevance or suitability.
meanings.sent1: The team discussed the inapplicabilities of the outdated strategy.
meanings.sent2: She realized the inapplicabilities of wearing flip-flops to a formal event.
meanings.sent3: The inapplicabilities of bringing a beach ball to a job interview would be amusing.
meanings.sent4: His excuses were like the inapplicabilities of using a fork to eat soup.
meanings.sent5: The inapplicabilities of using a ladder as a pillow were quite obvious.
